conclusion: To determine the trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2, we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph provided.
Acceleration is defined as the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, which corresponds to the slope of the v-t graph.
The graph shows the velocity (v) of object B as a function of time (t).
The slope of the v-t graph at any point represents the instantaneous acceleration of object B.
The red tangent lines in the second image indicate the slope at different points on the curve for object B.
At t = 0, the velocity of object B is zero, and the slope of the graph is positive (as the tangent line is upward sloping).

conclusion: Object B has a positive acceleration at t = 0.
As time progresses toward t1, the graph curves downward, and the slope decreases.

conclusion: The acceleration of object B decreases during the interval from t = 0 to t1.
At t1, the tangent line becomes horizontal, indicating that the slope is zero.

conclusion: The acceleration of object B is zero at t1.
After t1, the graph starts curving upward. The slope of the tangent lines begins to increase again.

By t2, the slope of the graph is steep and positive.

conclusion: The acceleration of object B has increased significantly by t2.
